metaphor.core: Batman's utility belt, filled with specialized gadgets that encapsulate complex functionalities into reusable tools, serves as a metaphor for custom React hooks. Custom hooks allow developers to extract and reuse stateful logic across multiple components, streamlining development and preventing code duplication, much like Batman's gadgets solve repeatable problems efficiently.

mapping.fictionElement: Grapple Gun (complex ascent in one fluid action)
mapping.reactConcept: A custom hook (`useGrapple`) encapsulating complex stateful logic (animation, timers, state management) into a single, reusable function
A custom hook (`useSmokeBomb`) encapsulating related state and logic for a specific UI concern

mapping.fictionElement: Building a solution 'on the fire escape' (raw rope, clumsy ascent)
mapping.reactConcept: Duplicating stateful logic directly within components, leading to code repetition, maintenance issues, and potential bugs (e.g., memory leaks from unmanaged effects)
Extracting common stateful logic into custom hooks, centralizing development and ensuring reliability

mapping.fictionElement: The 'Tale of Two Climbs' (young vs. veteran Batman)
mapping.reactConcept: The contrast between inefficient, duplicated logic and efficient, reusable custom hook implementation for common tasks

metaphor.narrativeArc: The module takes us through Batman's evolution from a less efficient crime-fighter struggling with raw tools (duplicated, stateful logic) to the masterful detective who leverages a well-equipped utility belt (custom hooks). It highlights the pain points of code duplication and mismanagement, introduces the 'Alfred Principle' of extracting reusable solutions, compares inefficient and efficient approaches, and culminates in showing how composing custom hooks builds a robust system.

problems: Code duplication across components for similar logic
Difficulty in sharing stateful logic without prop drilling or context overuse
Memory leaks due to improper cleanup in duplicated effects

chapters.title: The Arsenal in Action
chapters.focus: Introduces custom hooks as tools encapsulating complex, reusable logic.

chapters.title: The Price of Reinvention
chapters.focus: Demonstrates the problems and inefficiencies of duplicating stateful logic directly within components.

chapters.title: The Alfred Principle
chapters.focus: Explains the motivation behind custom hooks: extracting repeatable problems into reusable solutions.

chapters.title: The Tale of Two Climbs
chapters.focus: Compares the messy, inefficient approach of duplicated logic versus the clean, efficient use of custom hooks.

chapters.title: The Belt Is The System
chapters.focus: Illustrates how custom hooks compose to form a robust and maintainable application system.

Illustrating duplicated stateful logic and its inefficiencies (e.g., `BrokenWindowTracker`)
Interactive memory leak demonstration (buggy vs. fixed with cleanup)
Visual comparison of components using duplicated logic versus custom hooks
Showing multiple custom hooks composed within a single component
